intro: Septina, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their alternate, simple leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. Septina species are often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. They are noted for their ornamental value and have been used in traditional herbal medicine.
